title: My Sona based rework idea -RHYTHM-
body:
Sona as a champion mechanically has nothing to do with music and this irks me, So in light of all the Sona thread attempting to get attention, I will post my Idea of how to better her, I will disclaim that I don't know the balance in numbers for this Idea but I would like to see the rhythm mechanic become a thing as it would increase her skill ceiling tenfold, something she is in dire need of currently

**Rhythm**

<edited by moderation>

Sona now has a new resource bar under her mana bar, it does not deplete but it has a little bar that moves left and right, the bar has a different color in the center, if Sona casts an ability while the little bar is in the center color, she gains a stack of rhythm, works well as Sona has instant cast spells (Think like the active reload system in Gears or War, or the combat system in Undertale)
Rhythm would effect Sona's abilities and make them 10% stronger, for every stack of rhythm Sona the window to correctly cast a spell becomes smaller, but with every stack she gains 10% more potency to her spells, rhythm would have 5* maximum stacks and would be very difficult to correctly time, specially when you consider latency, So Sona would not be in 5* stack mode most of the game
If Sona does not cast a spell in 10 seconds, rhythm begins to deplete, for each stack of rhythm she has this depletion time is reduced by 1 second causing Sona to keep casting to keep up her stacks
If Sona does not hit the rhythm at the correct window frame she loses 2 stacks of rhythm
At level 6 and 11, the tempo increases

Initially this would mean that Sona's base spell values and ratios would need to be reduced by some value between 20-30%* but she can potential have her base spells be 50% more powerful

As a critique to myself on this idea, it's not exactly a great idea to keep your eyes glued to her resource bar all game, I can only suggest that with this resource, have Sona play her music, but have a music queue to indicate when she can cast a spell (maybe add an extra layer of reverb in the window of opportunity to cast, but just spitballing...)

*Numbers are numbers, they can change, I can't vision these numbers being implemented if this idea was used

So with this system, we have a Sona who has to know what she is doing, perform beautifully if the music queues were added, have to manage her resource to get do better and all in all, a skill ceiling that actually has room for improvement.
Would love critique on this Idea, this isn't a buff Sona thread, it's a make her a more skillful champion thread.

**[Critique Responses]**
**Mana **- Combo casting and keeping up with rhythm stacks would make her oom all the time
True, maybe having more rhythm stacks could act like Cassiopia's old passive, reducing 10% of the mana cost for each stack 

**Predictability** - Enemies would know when to stay away from Sona
From what I explained from this post, I mentioned that it would take 1 second for the bar to move left to right, 1 second isn't a lot of time so really you can't anticipate it all the time

**Situation** - She should use spells when they are needed, not because of the minigame
Again, 1 second isn't a lot of time

I can understand what you mean, but since I don't personally play those 2 champs, this concept feels like Rumble or Vladimir to me.  Spend all game juggling the Mechanized Menace's spells to keep his heat in yellow or spamming the Hemomancer's Tithe's of Blood to keep its stacks maxed out.

Notice 1 important thing for all 4 of these champions: they do not use mana.  This should tell you, such a design cannot work on a champion that's been mana-gated without becoming a late-game mana-stacker like Ryze.  Especially in Sona's case the problem becomes two-fold: firstly Sona has the 3rd-lowest base mana amongst mage supports, she'd require at least Tear and RoA just to be able to participate in a teamfight; and secondly she has the mana-regen pattern of all mage supports, namely high base and low scaling which becomes counter-intuitive to the late-game mana-stacking item-path.  For sustained sieges and fights it's necessary she include a regen item as well.

All this on a support champion, I can't see this idea working without some serious changes across the board to her costs, mana and regen.

Not a huge fan of the idea because Sona's main goal (like any champion) should be to use her spells when the spells are needed... your idea encourages using W because "I have to, muh stacks" and not because the heal is needed. It'll make Sona choose between using spells when needed and not get the benefits of her Rhythm mechanic, or focus on her Rhythm stacks and end up wasting mana for "more powerful spells" that she'll end up wasting anyway to get her stacks.

Sona comes with low cooldown spammable spells, all her abilities can be timed correctly, also the implied amount of time it takes for the rhythm bar to go from one side to another would be one second, she can cast basically whenever she wants, just there is a 0.5 -0.1 second frame where she has to cast
Plus the tempo getting faster at every ult level allows her to have many opportunities to cast a spell
